items.summary: Fix backend registration persistence so that creating an account actually stores credentials, session tokens, and the initial user profile in canister state (i.e., all Map/collection updates performed during register/login/saveCallerUserProfile must be truly mutating/persisted, not discarded).

Make backend registration/login input normalization and uniqueness checks consistent and robust: sanitize (trim + lowercase) username/email/loginIdentifier before checking and storing, and ensure uniqueness checks and lookups always use the sanitized values.

Fix backend session creation/ownership bookkeeping so that validateSession accepts the token produced by a successful login for the same caller until it expires (no false invalidation due to token ownership mismatches).

Improve frontend error reporting for the registration flow so that when backend registration fails, the UI shows the specific mapped/allowlisted error message (e.g., already registered, username/email taken) rather than the generic 'Registration failed. Please try again.' whenever possible.
